name: places/ChIJc2CqbqBZwokRTxN6294CXj4
formattedAddress: 107 E 23rd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 107 E 23rd St, New York, NY 10010, USA

editorialSummary.text: Convenience chain offering grab-&-go bites & beverages, plus assorted newsstand items.

originalText.text:
Very affordable prices for a student. No Odor, Clean place. No stomach problems either food is safeüëç. Fast service. Yes sometimes there are homeless people outside and inside buying stuff but we are in the city and its hard to control that really. Homeless people need to eat too.

7/11 has chicken sandwiches, Hot dogs, Small bakery section in the front. Various snacks and Cup of noodles in the back. Make yourself coffee or tea. I think its decent for a small 7/11.
So far no problems with this store, Went here multiple times.

originalText.text: They are so friendly, I love to go to over there after my college when I was hungry ü§§

text.text: They are so friendly, I love to go to over there after my college when I was hungry ü§§

originalText.text: Since when does 7/11 close? I arrived at 2:53AM and the 2 gentlemen were sitting behind the register doing absolutely nothing. They refused to unlock the door for me. What kind of non-sense is going on in this establishment. Thankfully there was one 10 minutes away that allowed me to purchase my water and chips. They also said they never heard of a 7/11 locking it‚Äôs doors, and they never close unless of an emergency.

text.text: Since when does 7/11 close? I arrived at 2:53AM and the 2 gentlemen were sitting behind the register doing absolutely nothing. They refused to unlock the door for me. What kind of non-sense is going on in this establishment. Thankfully there was one 10 minutes away that allowed me to purchase my water and chips. They also said they never heard of a 7/11 locking it‚Äôs doors, and they never close unless of an emergency.

originalText.text: Went at 5:30 am on a Friday and they were "closed" even though they had 3 employees inside. Happens a lot at this location

text.text: Went at 5:30 am on a Friday and they were "closed" even though they had 3 employees inside. Happens a lot at this location

originalText.text:
Homeless people stand outside begging for money, which I get is understandably annoying for the employees. But what's more annoying? I watched one of the employees steal money from a homeless man in a wheelchair who fell asleep. He looked me dead in the face and laughed like it was funny. I minded my business but I will be reaching out to corporate.

Update: I reached out 2x to the 711 feedback link that you previously posted. I will be waiting to hear back. But don't sit here and tell me "this doesn't sound right." The fact that you're supporting a dishonest employee is DESPICABLE! Check your cameras and Street cameras!

Update: 01/19/2023 - No response from this store or corporate. You tell me to reach out and I did. Case #CS1628662 .

NEVER SUPPORTING ANOTHER 711 AGAIN!

Final update 02/08/2023: I spoke with the area manager Mark, who told me they reviewed the footage and were able to take appropriate action, but just walked past this 7/11 and this employee was working behind the register. Good to know that 7/11 as a whole is not trust worthy in general that the Area Manager even lied.

Indefinitely no longer a customer of ANY 7/11 Establishment. App deleted.
